agent.@description: Web-based interface for submitting, editing, and reviewing studies in the Open Tree of Life project.

annotation.@description: Aids for mapping study OTUs to OTT taxa
Describes supporting data files for this study

nexml.^ot:comment:
I (Nick Matzke) manually digitized this tree from the three major monographs on North American fossil Canidae by Wang and Tedford:

Tedford, Richard H.; Wang, Xiaoming; Taylor, Beryl E. (2009). Phylogenetic systematics of the North American fossil Caninae (Carnivora, Canidae). Bulletin of the American Museum of Natural History, no. 325. http://hdl.handle.net/2246/5999

Wang, Xiaoming; Tedford, Richard H.; Taylor, Beryl E. (1999). Phylogenetic systematics of the Borophaginae (Carnivora, Canidae). Bulletin of the American Museum of Natural History, no. 243. http://hdl.handle.net/2246/1588

Wang, Xiaoming (1994). Phylogenetic systematics of the Hesperocyoninae (Carnivora, Canidae). Bulletin of the  American Museum of Natural History, no. 221. http://hdl.handle.net/2246/829

Digitization was done with TreeRogue and GraphClick, from their summary figures. Various judgement calls were required; my goal was to preserve the authors' depiction of divergence times. Use at your own risk.
nexml.^ot:studyPublicationReference: Tedford, Richard H.; Wang, Xiaoming; Taylor, Beryl E. (2009). Phylogenetic systematics of the North American fossil Caninae (Carnivora, Canidae). Bulletin of the American Museum of Natural History, no. 325. http://hdl.handle.net/2246/5999
